N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1211.140 - Nuclear, fissionable or radioactive material

State Regulations

No vehicle shall enter either a tunnel, the George

Washington Bridge Lower Level or George Washington Expressway if its load
includes any nuclear or fissionable material, radioactive residue or waste or
any radioactive material, except: (a) when the load includes specifically packaged and labeled magnesium-thorium
alloys in formed shapes (not powdered, and which shall contain not more than
four percent nominal thorium 232), or
(b) when the radioactive material is such
that it is exempt from all D.O.T. specification packaging, marking, and
labeling because of type and quantity, but not exempt by reason of Atomic

Energy Commission shipment and escort, military convoy, or other special
authorization, but
(c) vehicles
transporting radioactive materials which are not exempt from this section by
reason of subdivisions (a) or (b) are allowed passage when all of the following
conditions are fulfilled: (1)
the radioactive
material consists solely of manufactured articles other than liquids, namely
instrument or clock dials or electronic tubes of which radioactive materials
are a component part, and
(2)
the
radioactive material is being shipped in conformity with all D.O.T. regulations
including but not limited to all packaging, marking, and labeling requirements, and
(3)
the gross weight of the
radioactive material and its containers does not exceed 500 pounds per vehicle, and
(4)
special permission for
passage of each such vehicle is obtained from the facility manager. Notes
